Content: Is it weird to joke about being OCD at work? I did this and people began to think I was actually OCD.

Normally I'm not super sensitive but it bothers me how people misuse medical conditions as slurs or jokes, especially in the office. OCD is not a cutesy description. Bipolar is not a cutesy description. Alcoholic is not a cutesy description. These are real medical conditions and it is cruel and offensive to use them as slurs or jokes. If you don't go around calling people f*ggots and r*tards then don't go around calling people bipolar, OCD, or alcoholic who aren't.

Is it time to end things when you think of how your life would be easier if you were single? I feel like I’m wasting my life with an immature partner who can never take accountability & feels he is never wrong. Asking him to clean up after himself results in him telling me I “bring no value and am a slob” despite the fact that I do majority of domestic duties and cooking (we both work). The house is ocd clean & I food prep all our meals. I’m still attractive & don’t want to waste my youth

I’ve been back at work for a few months after mat leave. But I am really struggling. I think it’s a severe case of PPD/A/OCD. I’m the only mom, let alone new mom, on the team. And constantly hearing how things are not good enough. I don’t know what to do. I work all the time and feel like I’m failing on all fronts. Did anybody else struggle with this? Does it ever get better?

Should I disclose to my boss that I have ocd? It doesn’t seem to impact my job other than the fact that it’s a huge hit on my confidence and I have anxiety over speaking up from time to time. Part of me thinks it would help but I also don’t want to be seen as a weak link

Attorney who shares a thin wall next to me can’t stop making repetitive guttural noises. Makes them every 90-120 seconds EVERY DAY. He seems to have Tourette’s or something. I have OCD and get driven crazy by repeated noises. After months of this, it has gotten to the point where I can’t focus and am constantly on edge. He’s obviously dealing with an involuntary condition, so I can’t just tell him to stop. There’s not an available office on our floor for me to shift to. What do I do?

It vexes me how OCD is used as a cutesy adjective. It can be a debilitating disability. Here I am at almost 2am with chemical burns all across my arms and hands and nails bleeding and peeled past the quick because of my OCD. I'm so tired of this. I hate this so much. It isn't a cute adjective or a funky quirk. When someone tells you please don't touch my stuff or me listen to them. I thought once I was an adult out of school into work people would be mature about this but they're not.

Have any of y’all sought accommodations related to your mental health diagnoses like ADHD, Autism, OCD, etc.?
What types of accommodations? Was it hard to secure? Has it helped?

Need some help from you all. I’m in specialty claims & I’m a high performer. I’m a team of 1. Hardly take time off due to the workload and because there’s nowhere else for the claims to go. I get paid well. The problem is, my boss is an “old dog”, is OCD and is on me all the time about how things aren’t perfectly the way he wants them to be. He also never acknowledges my efforts to control all the fires that I deal with and rather criticizes instead. Would anyone put up with this like I’ve been?

Any suggestions on how to deal with a partner gaslighting you? She is OCD and micromanaging. She frequently comments that she wants concepts phrased a certain way in a document—let’s say phrase “X”. Then, after another review, she’ll say “Why the hell did you write X? It should be Y!” I’ve tried documenting by email, but she knows she contradicts herself and avoids email. I’m really trying to work with other partners more, but she keeps piling work on me. Might make me leave this firm soon.
Does anyone have a recommendation for a very experienced and competent doctor who treats OCD?

Does anyone have an OCD or OCD tendency? What do you do when you start feeling very very bad and there is no stopping feeling like crap for hours to the point you just cannot think of anything else and stay fixated. What do you do? Coping success stories without any reliance on medical help would be great.

Have any of y’all sought accommodations related to your mental health diagnoses like ADHD, Autism, OCD, etc.?
What types of accommodations? Was it hard to secure? Has it helped?

ADHD + anxiety = OCD like symptoms? When I’m very anxious about something, I develop some routines and become hyper focused on my anxiety. For instance, I have flight anxiety, and I obsessively check turbulence ahead of time days in advance, I don’t fly into certain airports, I only sit on window seats over the wings, etc. I would cancel a flight or pay extra to follow “the protocol.” I’ve done it for a few other things as well. Has anyone experienced this?
If you’ve successfully managed OCD or depression without medication, can you share your experience? Why didn’t you use medication? And what non-medication psychotherapeutic treatments worked best?
Anyone ever get put on meds for OCD? I’m worried about them affecting my creativity

How do you guys handle or control your brain.
I overthink a lot, I get lot of tension.
I have very low patience, due to which I make some bad decisions in life.
I confirm even small things with others before doing anything.
Have developed OCD.
I am very innocent (maybe dumb), I don't know how to fight back, even if I know the other person is fooling me, still I don't resist, it caused me money loss too.
My mind will kill me one day. I was not this personality before.
Please help and guide.

Have you had an oh... ahhhhh I get it now moment? Because we use so many acronyms...

I have loads of these...

My husband came home one day with a little trophy from work and it said best performer for OCT... and I sat there for hours thinking... what is OCT... Is it like OCD? What could it stand for...

Ask him a few hours later.. it was October 😅
For those OCd, what was your firm category (MBB, T2, etc.), rank, what was your severance package, if any? Thanks!
For those OCd recently, what are the next steps looking like? Take the 2 months salary and network / look for other jobs in the region or go back to your home country?

I have no sense of smell, I'm deaf, I'm blind in right eye, Im diabetic, I have arthritis in all my joints. I am autistic and bipolar, I have anxiety, depression, PTSD, OCD, ADHD. I have learning disabilities. I'm not good with technology or interacting with other. I can't stand on my feet all day. I've been unemployed for about 8 months. I was in the fast food/restaurant industry for about 10 years but I was constantly job hopping every year cuz it's not a good job field for me.

I’m feeling desperate for help. I’m so depressed and suicidal right now. I have crippling OCD, CPTSD and I’m autistic. Plus I have an autoimmune condition that has caused chronic pain. I don’t think I can take working much longer with how bad my mental and physical health is. I want to work so badly but I’m struggling to get through everyday and it’s hurting my job performance. I’m about ready to give up. I wish I could go on part-time disability just so I have a chance to recover. I need advice

A contact at a company I have multiple projects going on with just can't seem to get the concept of email threads. She’ll just randomly choose a thread to reply to about a completely different project. It's driving me crazy! Is this just me being OCD? Isn't this just common best practice?

Have any of y’all sought accommodations for ADHD or any other mental health diagnoses like Autism, OCD, etc.?
What types of accommodations? Was it hard to secure? Has it helped?

Curious, if you know someone has OCD, do you intentionally half-azs your work bc you know that person will come by and do it right? Or do you simply not care and you're just a half-azs work type of person lol

Hi all - ISO advice on potential workplace accommodations to manage my severe combo ADHD, depression disorder and anxiety with OCD.

I take Concerta and Zoloft daily and propranolol as needed - tho the latter has become almost daily as my responsibilities at a PR agency increase.

Requested pre-reads, recording meetings and advised that email and a Teams message - doesn’t matter which comes first - are just some of the ways I work best, but it continues to fall on deaf ears.

For those not OCd but expecting a retention bonus in a couple of months for previous year performance, do you guys think they will just not pay it? It is discretionary but do you think they will exploit low attrition to justify not paying it?

Send help !! My ADHD/OCD is kicking my ass I got a ton of different outfits for training as they want us to be wearing business casual attire for 3 weeks !!! but I’m stuck on the shoes !! what kinds of shoes should I be wearing to training

I have severe social and general anxiety disorders. Along with ocd. Which I believe both go hand- in- hand.
But I also believe that my life situation effects my moods and makes my mental illnesses worse/ better.

I am looking for any painters job in the Central, N.J..
